00037 void depth_first_traversal_to_output(short marker_value, FILE *fp, netlist_t *netlist);
00038 void depth_traverse_output_blif(nnode_t *node, int traverse_mark_number, FILE *fp);

00045 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00046  * (function: output_blif)
00047  *      The function that prints out the details for a blif formatted file
00048  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00049 void output_blif(char *file_name, netlist_t *netlist)
00050 {
00051         int i;
00052         int count = 0;
00053         short first_time_inputs = FALSE;
00054         short first_time_outputs = FALSE;
00055         FILE *out;
00056 
00057         /* open the file for output */
00058         
00059         out = fopen(file_name, "w");
00060         if (out == NULL)
00061         {
00062                 error_message(NETLIST_ERROR, -1, -1, "Could not open output file %s\n", file_name);
00063         }
00064 
00065         fprintf(out, ".model %s\n", top_module->children[0]->types.identifier);
00066 
00067         /* generate all te signals */
00068         for (i = 0; i < netlist->num_top_input_nodes; i++)
00069         {
00070                 if (first_time_inputs == FALSE)
00071                 {
00072                         count = fprintf(out, ".inputs");
00073                         first_time_inputs = TRUE;
00074                 }
00075 
00076                 if (strlen(netlist->top_input_nodes[i]->name) + count < 79)
00077                         count = count + fprintf(out, " %s", netlist->top_input_nodes[i]->name);
00078                 else
00079                 {
00080                         /* wrapping line */
00081                         count = fprintf(out, " \\\n %s", netlist->top_input_nodes[i]->name);
00082                         count = count - 3;
00083                 }
00084         }
00085         fprintf(out, "\n");
00086 
00087         count = 0;
00088         for (i = 0; i < netlist->num_top_output_nodes; i++)
00089         {
00090                 if (netlist->top_output_nodes[i]->input_pins[0]->net->driver_pin == NULL)
00091                 {
00092                         warning_message(NETLIST_ERROR, netlist->top_output_nodes[i]->related_ast_node->line_number, netlist->top_output_nodes[i]->related_ast_node->file_number, "This output is undriven (%s) and will be removed\n", netlist->top_output_nodes[i]->name);
00093                 }
00094                 else
00095                 {       
00096                         if (first_time_outputs == FALSE)
00097                         {
00098                                 count = fprintf(out, ".outputs");
00099                                 first_time_outputs = TRUE;
00100                         }
00101         
00102                         if ((strlen(netlist->top_output_nodes[i]->name) + count) < 79)
00103                                 count = count + fprintf(out, " %s", netlist->top_output_nodes[i]->name);
00104                         else
00105                         {
00106                                 /* wrapping line */
00107                                 count = fprintf(out, "\\\n %s", netlist->top_output_nodes[i]->name);
00108                                 count = count - 3;
00109                         }
00110                 }
00111         }
00112         fprintf(out, "\n");
00113 
00114         /* add gnd and vcc */
00115         fprintf(out, "\n.names gnd\n.names vcc\n1\n");
00116         fprintf(out, "\n");
00117 
00118         /* traverse the internals of the flat net-list */
00119         if (strcmp(configuration.output_type, "blif") == 0)
00120         {
00121                 depth_first_traversal_to_output(OUTPUT_TRAVERSE_VALUE, out, netlist);   
00122         }
00123         else
00124                 oassert(FALSE);
00125 
00126         /* connect all the outputs up to the last gate */
00127         for (i = 0; i < netlist->num_top_output_nodes; i++)
00128         {
00129                 if (netlist->top_output_nodes[i]->input_pins[0]->net->driver_pin != NULL)
00130                 {
00131                         fprintf(out, ".names %s %s\n1 1\n", netlist->top_output_nodes[i]->input_pins[0]->net->driver_pin->node->name, netlist->top_output_nodes[i]->name);  
00132                 }
00133         }
00134         /* finish off the top level module */
00135         fprintf(out, ".end\n");
00136         fprintf(out, "\n");
00137 
00138         /* Print out any hard block modules */
00139         add_the_blackbox_for_mults(out);
00140 
00141         fclose(out);
00142 }
00143 
00144 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00145  * (function: depth_first_traversal_to_parital_map()
00146  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00147 void depth_first_traversal_to_output(short marker_value, FILE *fp, netlist_t *netlist)
00148 {
00149         int i;
00150 
00151         netlist->gnd_node->name = "gnd";
00152         netlist->vcc_node->name = "vcc";
00153         /* now traverse the ground and vcc pins */
00154         depth_traverse_output_blif(netlist->gnd_node, marker_value, fp);
00155         depth_traverse_output_blif(netlist->vcc_node, marker_value, fp);
00156 
00157         /* start with the primary input list */
00158         for (i = 0; i < netlist->num_top_input_nodes; i++)
00159         {
00160                 if (netlist->top_input_nodes[i] != NULL)
00161                 {
00162                         depth_traverse_output_blif(netlist->top_input_nodes[i], marker_value, fp);
00163                 }
00164         }
00165 }
00166 
00167 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00168  * (function: depth_first_traverse)
00169  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00170 void depth_traverse_output_blif(nnode_t *node, int traverse_mark_number, FILE *fp)
00171 {
00172         int i, j;
00173         nnode_t *next_node;
00174         nnet_t *next_net;
00175 
00176         if (node->traverse_visited == traverse_mark_number)
00177         {
00178                 return;
00179         }
00180         else
00181         {
00182                 /* ELSE - this is a new node so depth visit it */
00183 
00184                 /* POST traverse  map the node since you might delete */
00185                 output_node(node, traverse_mark_number, fp);
00186 
00187                 /* mark that we have visitied this node now */
00188                 node->traverse_visited = traverse_mark_number;
00189 
00190                 for (i = 0; i < node->num_output_pins; i++)
00191                 {
00192                         if (node->output_pins[i]->net == NULL)
00193                                 continue;
00194 
00195                         next_net = node->output_pins[i]->net;
00196                         for (j = 0; j < next_net->num_fanout_pins; j++)
00197                         {
00198                                 if (next_net->fanout_pins[j] == NULL)
00199                                         continue;
00200 
00201                                 next_node = next_net->fanout_pins[j]->node;
00202                                 if (next_node == NULL)
00203                                         continue;
00204 
00205                                 /* recursive call point */
00206                                 depth_traverse_output_blif(next_node, traverse_mark_number, fp);
00207                         }
00208                 }
00209 
00210         }
00211 }
00212 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
00213  * (function: partial_map_node)
00214  *      Depending on node type, figures out what to print for this node
00215  *------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00216 void output_node(nnode_t *node, short traverse_number, FILE *fp)
00217 {
00218         switch (node->type) 
00219         {
00220                 case GT:
00221                         define_set_input_logical_function(node, "100 1\n", fp);
00222                         oassert(node->num_input_pins == 3);
00223                         oassert(node->input_pins[2] != NULL);
00224                         break;
00225                 case LT:
00226                         define_set_input_logical_function(node, "010 1\n", fp); // last input decides if this 
00227                         oassert(node->num_input_pins == 3);
00228                         oassert(node->input_pins[2] != NULL);
00229                         break;
00230                 case ADDER_FUNC:
00231                         define_set_input_logical_function(node, "001 1\n010 1\n100 1\n111 1\n", fp);
00232                         break;
00233                 case CARRY_FUNC:
00234                         define_set_input_logical_function(node, "011 1\n100 1\n110 1\n111 1\n", fp);
00235                         break;
00236                 case BITWISE_NOT:
00237                         define_set_input_logical_function(node, "0 1\n", fp);
00238                         break;  
00239 
00240                 case LOGICAL_AND:
00241                 case LOGICAL_OR:
00242                 case LOGICAL_XOR:
00243                 case LOGICAL_XNOR:
00244                 case LOGICAL_NAND:
00245                 case LOGICAL_NOR:
00246                 case LOGICAL_EQUAL:
00247                 case NOT_EQUAL:
00248                 case LOGICAL_NOT:
00249                         define_logical_function(node, node->type, fp);
00250                         break;  
00251 
00252                 case MUX_2:
00253                         define_decoded_mux(node, fp);
00254                         break;
00255 
00256                 case FF_NODE:
00257                         define_ff(node, fp);
00258                         break;
00259 
00260                 case MULTIPLY:
00261                         if (hard_multipliers == NULL)
00262                                 oassert(FALSE); /* should be soft logic! */
00263                         define_mult_function(node, node->type, fp);
00264                         break;
00265 
00266                 case INPUT_NODE:
00267                 case OUTPUT_NODE:
00268                 case CLOCK_NODE:
00269                 case GND_NODE:
00270                 case VCC_NODE:
00271                         /* some nodes already converted */
00272                         break;
00273 
00274                 case BITWISE_AND:
00275                 case BITWISE_NAND:
00276                 case BITWISE_NOR:
00277                 case BITWISE_XNOR:
00278                 case BITWISE_XOR:
00279                 case BITWISE_OR:
00280                 case BUF_NODE:
00281                 case MULTI_PORT_MUX:
00282                 case SL:
00283                 case SR:
00284                 case CASE_EQUAL:
00285                 case CASE_NOT_EQUAL:
00286                 case DIVIDE:
00287                 case MODULO:
00288                 case GTE:
00289                 case LTE:
00290                 case ADD:
00291                 case MINUS:
00292                 default:
00293                         /* these nodes should have been converted to softer versions */
00294                         oassert(FALSE);
00295                         break;
00296         }
00297 }

00299 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00300  * (function: define_logical_function)
00301  *-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00302 void define_logical_function(nnode_t *node, short type, FILE *out)
00303 {
00304         int i, j;
00305         char *temp_string;
00306 
00307         fprintf(out, ".names");
00308 
00309         /* printout all the port hookups */
00310         for (i = 0; i < node->num_input_pins; i++)
00311         {
00312                 /* now hookup the input wires with their respective ports.  [1+i] to skip output spot. */
00313                 fprintf(out, " %s", node->input_pins[i]->net->driver_pin->node->name); 
00314         }
00315         /* now print the output */
00316         fprintf(out, " %s", node->name);
00317         fprintf(out, "\n");
00318 
00319         oassert(node->num_output_pins == 1);
00320 
00321         /* print out the blif definition of this gate */
00322         switch (node->type) 
00323         {
00324                 case LOGICAL_AND:
00325                 {
00326                         /* generates: 111111 1 */
00327                         for (i = 0; i < node->num_input_pins; i++)
00328                         {
00329                                 fprintf(out, "1");
00330                         }
00331                         fprintf(out, " 1\n");
00332                         break;
00333                 }
00334                 case LOGICAL_OR:
00335                 {
00336                         /* generates: 1----- 1\n-1----- 1\n ... */
00337                         for (i = 0; i < node->num_input_pins; i++)
00338                         {
00339                                 for (j = 0; j < node->num_input_pins; j++)
00340                                 {
00341                                         if (i == j)
00342                                                 fprintf(out, "1");
00343                                         else
00344                                                 fprintf(out, "-");
00345                                 }
00346                                 fprintf(out, " 1\n");
00347                         }
00348                         break;
00349                 }
00350                 case LOGICAL_NAND:
00351                 {
00352                         /* generates: 0----- 1\n-0----- 1\n ... */
00353                         for (i = 0; i < node->num_input_pins; i++)
00354                         {
00355                                 for (j = 0; j < node->num_input_pins; j++)
00356                                 {
00357                                         if (i == j)
00358                                                 fprintf(out, "0");
00359                                         else
00360                                                 fprintf(out, "-");
00361                                 }
00362                                 fprintf(out, " 1\n");
00363                         }
00364                         break;
00365                 }
00366                 case LOGICAL_NOT:
00367                 case LOGICAL_NOR:
00368                 {
00369                         /* generates: 0000000 1 */
00370                         for (i = 0; i < node->num_input_pins; i++)
00371                         {
00372                                 fprintf(out, "0");
00373                         }
00374                         fprintf(out, " 1\n");
00375                         break;
00376                 }
00377                 case LOGICAL_EQUAL:
00378                 case LOGICAL_XNOR:
00379                 {
00380                         /* generates: a 1 when odd number of 1s */
00381                         for (i = 0; i < my_power(2, node->num_input_pins); i++)
00382                         {
00383                                 if ((i % 8 == 1) || (i % 8 == 2) || (i % 8 == 5) || (i % 8 == 6))
00384                                 {
00385                                         temp_string = convert_long_to_bit_string(i, node->num_input_pins);
00386                                         fprintf(out, "%s", temp_string);
00387                                         free(temp_string);
00388                                         fprintf(out, " 1\n");
00389                                 }
00390                         }
00391                         break;
00392                 }
00393                 case NOT_EQUAL:
00394                 case LOGICAL_XOR:
00395                 {
00396                         for (i = 0; i < my_power(2, node->num_input_pins); i++)
00397                         {
00398                                 if ((i % 8 == 0) || (i % 8 == 3) || (i % 8 == 4) || (i % 8 == 7))
00399                                 {
00400                                         temp_string = convert_long_to_bit_string(i, node->num_input_pins);
00401                                         fprintf(out, "%s", temp_string);
00402                                         free(temp_string);
00403                                         fprintf(out, " 1\n");
00404                                 }
00405                         }
00406                         break;
00407                 }
00408                 default:
00409                         oassert(FALSE);
00410                         break;
00411         }
00412 
00413         fprintf(out, "\n");
00414 }

00416 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------
00417  * (function: define_set_input_logical_function)
00418  *----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00419 void define_set_input_logical_function(nnode_t *node, char *bit_output, FILE *out)
00420 {
00421         int i;
00422 
00423         fprintf(out, ".names");
00424 
00425         oassert(node->num_output_pins == 1);
00426         oassert(node->num_input_pins >= 1);
00427 
00428         /* printout all the port hookups */
00429         for (i = 0; i < node->num_input_pins; i++)
00430         {
00431                 /* now hookup the input wires with their respective ports.  [1+i] to skip output spot. */
00432                 fprintf(out, " %s", node->input_pins[i]->net->driver_pin->node->name); 
00433         }
00434 
00435         /* now print the output */
00436         fprintf(out, " %s", node->name);
00437         fprintf(out, "\n");
00438 
00439         /* print out the blif definition of this gate */
00440         if (bit_output != NULL)
00441         {
00442                 fprintf(out, "%s", bit_output);
00443         }
00444         fprintf(out, "\n");
00445 }

00448 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00449  * (function: define_ff)
00450  *-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00451 void define_ff(nnode_t *node, FILE *out)
00452 {
00453         oassert(node->num_output_pins == 1);
00454         oassert(node->num_input_pins == 2);
00455 
00456         /* input, output, clock */
00457         fprintf(out, ".latch %s %s re %s 0", node->input_pins[0]->net->driver_pin->node->name, node->name, node->input_pins[1]->net->driver_pin->node->name);
00458 
00459         fprintf(out, "\n");
00460 }

00462 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00463  * (function: define_decoded_mux)
00464  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00465 void define_decoded_mux(nnode_t *node, FILE *out)
00466 {
00467         int i, j;
00468 
00469         oassert(node->input_port_sizes[0] == node->input_port_sizes[1]);
00470 
00471         fprintf(out, ".names");
00472 
00473         /* printout all the port hookups */
00474         for (i = 0; i < node->num_input_pins; i++)
00475         {
00476                 /* now hookup the input wires with their respective ports.  [1+i] to skip output spot. */
00477                 fprintf(out, " %s", node->input_pins[i]->net->driver_pin->node->name); 
00478         }
00479         /* now print the output */
00480         fprintf(out, " %s", node->name);
00481         fprintf(out, "\n");
00482 
00483         oassert(node->num_output_pins == 1);
00484 
00485         /* generates: 1----- 1\n-1----- 1\n ... */
00486         for (i = 0; i < node->input_port_sizes[0]; i++)
00487         {
00488                 for (j = 0; j < node->num_input_pins; j++)
00489                 {
00490                         if (i == j)
00491                                 fprintf(out, "1");
00492                         else if (i+node->input_port_sizes[0] == j)
00493                                 fprintf(out, "1");
00494                         else if (i > node->input_port_sizes[0])
00495                                 fprintf(out, "0");
00496                         else
00497                                 fprintf(out, "-");
00498                 }
00499                 fprintf(out, " 1\n");
00500         }
00501 
00502         fprintf(out, "\n");
00503 }
